bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, November 27, 1900
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Con & Rurder & Non. Reply wadon &c How about Circular 7 Cubler
No. 55. Consular, Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia; Nov. 27, 1900.
Hon. David J. Hill. Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

p.add: Acknowledged and to Ms Rooker January 9, 1901 Consular Bureau JAN 8 1901 [see his no. 63. Feb 19, 1901]

div1.p: Subject. William Porker, late Spokane, Washington.

Synopsis. William Porker late of Spokane, State of Washington, reached Monrovia, near Sept. 1, 1900, Left for Robertsport, (Cape Mount) Liberia, Sept. 27, 1900, and died at Robertsport, Nov. 13, 1900.
No. 55. Consular, Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia; Nov. 27, 1900
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to transmit to you the intelligence, that William Porker, late of Spokane, State of Washington, who reached Monrovia, on or about Sept. 1, 1900, for Robertsport, (Cape Mount) Liberia; died at Robertsport, Nov. 13, 1900. His widow, Mrs. Emma porker, in stil in the United States, and resides at No. 325, First Ave. South; Minneapolis, Minn. I
I have not notified the widow.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith, M. R. and C. General.
